intro: Mapania bougainvillensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian pohuehue, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking clusters of papery, colorful bracts that surround small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic, and have a smooth, glossy surface. Mapania bougainvillensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
